quotes.quote: The most important factor in survival is neither intelligence nor strength but adaptability.
The key to success is often the ability to adapt.
All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
Change is the only constant in life. Ones ability to adapt to those changes will determine your success in life.
Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass. It's about learning how to dance in the rain.
It is not balance you need but adaptability.
Adaptability cushions the impact of change or disappointment.
We must cut our coat according to our cloth, and adapt ourselves to changing circumstances.
Action and adaptability create opportunity.
The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
Adaptability is a great asset to have because life is so unpredictable, and things can change overnight for any of us.
The more you adapt, the more interesting you are.
Be flexible and adapt easily to new things.
Adaptability is being able to adjust to any situation at any given time.
The strongest will is the will that knows how to bend.
Adaptability to change is itself a hallmark of successful education.
To exist is to adapt, and if one could not adapt, one died and made room for those who could.
It is not the strongest or the most intelligent who will survive but those who can best manage change.

Intelligence is ongoing, individual adaptability. Adaptations that an intelligent species may make in a single generation, other species make over many generations of selective breeding and selective dying.
Forgive, Adapt and Evolve, because holding on stagnates your opportunity of being better.
You must always be able to predict what's next and then have the flexibility to evolve.
Adaptability is the simple secret of survival.
One learns to adapt to the land in which one lives.
Man adapts himself to everything, to the best and the worst.
As the world we live in is so unpredictable, the ability to learn and to adapt to change is imperative, alongside creativity, problem-solving, and communication skills.
The art of life lies in a constant readjustment to our surroundings.
The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
Adaptability is about the powerful difference between adapting to cope and adapting to win.
You can't just keep doing what works one time, everything around you is changing. To succeed, stay out in front of change.
Be willing to change, because life won't stay the same.
Adaptability is not imitation. It means power of resistance and assimilation.
We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails.
Enjoying success requires the ability to adapt.
It is a wise person that adapts themselves to all contingencies; it's the fool who always struggles like a swimmer against the current.
The most amazing thing about little children was their fantastic adaptability.
